About Dr. Mary Jo Trepka
Dr. Mary Jo Trepka is a professor and chair of the Department of Epidemiology at the FIU Robert Stempel College of Public Health & Social Work. She is board certified in preventive medicine and public health and was trained as an epidemic intelligence service officer by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Before joining FIU in 2003, she served as Miami-Dade Countyâ€™s epidemiologist and was responsible for the surveillance and control of infectious diseases.
About the Faculty Lecture Series
The Faculty Lecture Series is an initiative designed to connect students, faculty, staff, and the broader community with timely, expert-led insights on todayâ€™s most pressing health-related topics. The lecture series was created by the Academic Health Center team to feature presentations by FIU faculty and leading healthcare experts on a range of subjects including emerging research, medical innovations, public health issues, and the evolving landscape of healthcare technology and policy. Each session offers attendees the opportunity to engage with experts, deepen their understanding of current health challenges, and explore the future of health and medicine.

]]>tag:localist.com,2008:EventInstance_49056012832392Tue, 24 Jun 2025 00:00:00 -04002025-06-24T00:00:00-04:00https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/fall-open-registration-for-degree-seeking-studentsAcademicsDates & DeadlinesJun 24, 2025: 20th Annual Government Statewide Conference at GC - Graham University CenterHello Panther! 
Interested in learning more about public service career opportunities? Did you know the local, state, and federal government agencies and departments offer internships, full-time and part-time career opportunities and fellowships? Join us at the 20th Annual Government Statewide Conference to meet hiring managers, recruiters, and representatives! Learn about preparing for and applying to federal career opportunities!
Date: Tuesday June 24th, 2025
Time: 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. EDT
Location: Florida International University, Modesto A. Maidique Campus, Graham Center, GC Ballroom
Address: 11200 SW 8th St, Miami, FL 33199
This 20th Annual Government Statewide Conference is designed to bring representatives from various government entities together to discuss aspects of government employment, best practices, employment opportunities, and several other relevant topics geared for students, alumni, professionals, and veterans.
After our speaker and panelist sessions on government employment, we host a resource fair for participating agencies and students will get the opportunity to visit and network with each other.
The 20th Annual Government Conference is open to FIU students and alumni as well as Miami-Dade College and State University System of Florida students. All must register to attend on Handshake. All student attendees must present a college or university ID to be admitted.
If you have any questions, please contact Career and Talent Development at or call (305) 348-2423
Government Statewide Conference is open to all current FIU students and alumni

All requests for ADA accommodations or accessible materials for this event must be submitted to CRCA at least two weeks prior to the event or at the earliest possible opportunity.

<title>May 21, 2025: Cubaâ€™s Eternal Night at RDB - Rafael Diaz-Balart Law Building</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>What has become of Cuba since the historic protests of July 11, 2021â€”and the regimeâ€™s swift and brutal crackdown? Cubaâ€™s Eternal Night follows 5 Cubans over 2 harrowing years as they struggle with government repression, scarcity of food and medicine, and the biggest mass exodus the island has ever experienced. Yet amidst the darkness, these five individuals choose to share their lives, boldly and on camera, offering a rare and intimate look inside a nation unraveling. <br /> <br />Jordan Allott is a documentary filmmaker and founder of In Altum Productions (IAP). His work explores themes ranging from international human rights and American politics to Catholic spirituality. <br /> <br />Yoe SuÃ¡rez is an award-winning journalist and writer. He was an independent journalist in Cuba during the filming and became the filmÂ´s field producer. He now lives in the U.S. <br /> <br />Father Alberto Reyes PÃ­as is a Roman Catholic priest in the Archdiocese of CamagÃ¼ey, Cuba. He is one of the most articulate and courageous voices on freedom in Cuba today. <br /> <br />This event is free and open to the public. It will be held in Spanish. To confirm your in-person attendance, please write to <a href="mailto:cri@fiu.edu">cri@fiu.edu</a> or call at (305) 348â€“1991</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/cubas-eternal-night">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+Cuba%E2%80%99s+Eternal+Night&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+May+21%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0AWhat+has+become+of+Cuba+since+the+historic+protests+of+July+11%2C+2021%E2%80%94and+the+regime%E2%80%99s+swift+and+brutal+crackdown%3F+Cuba%E2%80%99s+Eternal+Night+follows+5+Cubans+over+2+harrowing+years+as+they+struggle+with+government+repression%2C+scarcity+of+food+and+medicine%2C+and+the+biggest+mass+exodus+the+island+has+ever+experienced.+Yet+amidst+the+darkness%2C+these+five+individuals+choose+to+share+their+lives%2C+boldly+and+on+camera%2C+offering+a+rare+and+intimate+look+inside+a+nation+unraveling.%0A+%0AJordan+Allott+is+a+documentary+filmmaker+and+founder+of+In+Altum+Productions+%28IAP%29.+His+work+explores+themes+ranging+from+international+human+rights+and+American+politics+to+Catholic+spirituality.%0A+%0AYoe+Su%C3%A1rez+is+an+award-winning+journalist+and+writer.+He+was+an+independent+journalist+in+Cuba+during+the+filming+and+became+the+film%C2%B4s+field+producer.+He+now+lives+in+the+U.S.%0A+%0AFather+Alberto+Reyes+P%C3%ADas+is+a+Roman+Catholic+priest+in+the+Archdiocese+of+Camag%C3%BCey%2C+Cuba.+He+is+one+of+the+most+articulate+and+courageous+voices+on+freedom+in+Cuba+today.%0A+%0AThis+event+is+free+and+open+to+the+public.+It+will+be+held+in+Spanish.+To+confirm+your+in-person+attendance%2C+please+write+to+cri%40fiu.edu+or+call+at+%28305%29+348%E2%80%931991%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2Fcubas-eternal-night%0A">Email this event</a></p> ]]>

<title>May 22, 2025: Creole Archive Project: PolonÃ© Nwa - Constitution 1805 Exhibition by Dr. Jacek KolasiÅ„ski at MBUS - SoA Miami Beach Urban Studios</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Friday, May 9, 2025. To celebrate Haitian Heritage Month, the Creole Archive Project: PolonÃ© Nwa - Constitution 1805 by Dr. Jacek KolasiÅ„ski invites viewers to uncover a powerful and often forgotten chapter of Haitian and Polish history. The exhibition explores the unlikely alliance between Polish legionnaires and Haitian revolutionaries during the fight for Haitiâ€™s independence. The exhibition is on view through June 27, 2025. Design Gallery, SoA Miami Beach Urban Studios, 420 Lincoln Rd, Miami Beach, FL. Free and open to the public. <title>May 27, 2025: Faculty Lecture Series: All eyes on Measles at SASC - Student Academic Success Center</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Join us for All Eyes on Measlesâ€”the first event in FIU Academic Health Center's new Faculty Lecture Seriesâ€”and learn from one of our top public health experts. Dr. Mary Jo Trepka, Chair and Professor of Epidemiology at Stempel College, will discuss the history of measles, its current resurgence, and its impact on public health.</p> <p> </p> <p>This lecture is open to all FIU students, faculty, and staff. It is offered at no cost and lunch will be served. </p> <p> </p> <p>Tuesday, May 27, 2025 | 11:30 a.m. - 1:00 p.m.</p> <p> SASC, 160 | FIU Modesto A. Maidique Campus </p> <p> </p> <p>About Dr. Mary Jo Trepka</p> <p> </p> <p>Dr. Mary Jo Trepka is a professor and chair of the Department of Epidemiology at the FIU Robert Stempel College of Public Health &amp; Social Work. She is board certified in preventive medicine and public health and was trained as an epidemic intelligence service officer by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Before joining FIU in 2003, she served as Miami-Dade Countyâ€™s epidemiologist and was responsible for the surveillance and control of infectious diseases.</p> <p> </p> <p>About the Faculty Lecture Series</p> <p> </p> <p>The Faculty Lecture Series is an initiative designed to connect students, faculty, staff, and the broader community with timely, expert-led insights on todayâ€™s most pressing health-related topics. The lecture series was created by the Academic Health Center team to feature presentations by FIU faculty and leading healthcare experts on a range of subjects including emerging research, medical innovations, public health issues, and the evolving landscape of healthcare technology and policy. Each session offers attendees the opportunity to engage with experts, deepen their understanding of current health challenges, and explore the future of health and medicine.</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/all-eyes-on-measles">View on site</a> | <a <title>May 29, 2025: Language, Culture and Society in Havana in 1830 at GL - Green Library</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>The objective of this conference is to identify particularities of that interest in the Spanish language and the inclination for lexicographic activity in Cuba in the years before the appearance of Esteban Pichardoâ€™s Diccionario provincial de voces cubanas in 1836. This conference reconstructs the creative and bibliographic environment of that pioneering group in 1830, who had the good sense to work as a team, recognize aspects of Cuban identity, and capture the various voices and phrases used by their contemporaries on the island.</p> <p>GUEST SPEAKER: Dr. Armando ChÃ¡vez-Rivera. Associate Professor and Director of the Spanish Program at the University of Houston-Victoria, Texas, and a Scholar in Residence at the Kluge Center at the Library of Congress. Member of the North American Academy of the Spanish Language.</p> <p>This event is co-sponsored by the Kimberly Green Latin America and Caribbean Center and FIU Libraries. This event is made possible with the support of LACC's Department of Education Title VI Grant. <description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Dictionaries and encyclopedias from Europe inspired a group of intellectuals in Havana to compile the typical voices of Cuba around 1830. This effort resulted in a vocabulary that remained unpublished for 190 years, until Dr. ChÃ¡vez-Rivera edited and published it in 2021. The original manuscript circulated in the XIX century and was an influence on the island and abroad. The objective of this conference is to identify particularities of that interest in the Spanish language and the inclination for lexicographic activity in Cuba in the years prior to the appearance of Esteban Pichardoâ€™s Diccionario provincial de voces cubanas in 1836. This conference reconstructs the creative and bibliographic environment of that pioneering group in 1830 who had the good sense to work as a team, recognize aspects of Cuban identity, and capture the various voices and phrases used by their contemporaries on the island. </p> <p> </p> <p>GUEST SPEAKER: Dr. Armando ChÃ¡vez-Rivera. <title>May 30, 2025: Creole Archive Project: PolonÃ© Nwa - Constitution 1805 Exhibition by Dr. Jacek KolasiÅ„ski at MBUS - SoA Miami Beach Urban Studios</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Friday, May 9, 2025. To celebrate Haitian Heritage Month, the Creole Archive Project: PolonÃ© Nwa - Constitution 1805 by Dr. Jacek KolasiÅ„ski invites viewers to uncover a powerful and often forgotten chapter of Haitian and Polish history. <item>
<title>Jun 3, 2025: 2025 Global Forensic Science Symposium at MARC - Management & Advanced Research</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>The 2025 Global Forensic Science Symposium will present ground-breaking forensic science research from 40 experts worldwide. This unique event brings together law enforcement agencies, industry, and academia to share knowledge and training for laboratory professionals. Our theme this year is Collaboration in Forensic Scienceâ€”an essential practice to advance the disciplines across campus and around the world.</p> <p>Presentation topics include: Medico-Legal Death Investigation, DNA, Genetic Genealogy, Toxicology, Canine Sensors, Illicit Drug Trade, Contamination Detection, Trace Evidence, Nanotechnology, Explosives, Crime Scene Photography, Chemical Analysis, Quantification, Fingerprint Development, Digital and Crypto Forensics, Mass Disaster Victim Management, Firearms, Accreditation, Certification, and Laboratory Operations.</p> <p>Schedule: <br />Tuesday, June 3: In-person, MARC 290, and live-streamed online <br />Wednesday &amp; Thursday, June 4 &amp; 5: Livestream only</p> <p>Whether you attend in-person or virtually - registration is FREE! <description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Friday, May 9, 2025. To celebrate Haitian Heritage Month, the Creole Archive Project: PolonÃ© Nwa - Constitution 1805 by Dr. Jacek KolasiÅ„ski invites viewers to uncover a powerful and often forgotten chapter of Haitian and Polish history. The exhibition explores the unlikely alliance between Polish legionnaires and Haitian revolutionaries during the fight for Haitiâ€™s independence. The exhibition is on view through June 27, 2025. <title>Jun 5, 2025: 2025 Global Forensic Science Symposium at MARC - Management & Advanced Research</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>The 2025 Global Forensic Science Symposium will present ground-breaking forensic science research from 40 experts worldwide. This unique event brings together law enforcement agencies, industry, and academia to share knowledge and training for laboratory professionals. Our theme this year is Collaboration in Forensic Scienceâ€”an essential practice to advance the disciplines across campus and around the world.</p> <p>Presentation topics include: Medico-Legal Death Investigation, DNA, Genetic Genealogy, Toxicology, Canine Sensors, Illicit Drug Trade, Contamination Detection, Trace Evidence, Nanotechnology, Explosives, Crime Scene Photography, Chemical Analysis, Quantification, Fingerprint Development, Digital and Crypto Forensics, Mass Disaster Victim Management, Firearms, Accreditation, Certification, and Laboratory Operations.</p> <p>Schedule: <br />Tuesday, June 3: In-person, MARC 290, and live-streamed online <br />Wednesday &amp; Thursday, June 4 &amp; 5: Livestream only</p> <p>Whether you attend in-person or virtually - registration is FREE! </p> <p>Register today at go.fiu.edu/FSSregistration.</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/2025-global-forensic-science-symposium">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+2025+Global+Forensic+Science+Symposium&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Jun+5%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0AThe+2025+Global+Forensic+Science+Symposium+will+present+ground-breaking+forensic+science+research+from+40+experts+worldwide.+This+unique+event+brings+together+law+enforcement+agencies%2C+industry%2C+and+academia+to+share+knowledge+and+training+for+laboratory+professionals.+Our+theme+this+year+is+Collaboration+in+Forensic+Science%E2%80%94an+essential+practice+to+advance+the+disciplines+across+campus+and+around+the+world.%0A%0APresentation+topics+include%3A+Medico-Legal+Death+Investigation%2C+DNA%2C+Genetic+Genealogy%2C+Toxicology%2C+Canine+Sensors%2C+Illicit+Drug+Trade%2C+Contamination+Detection%2C+Trace+Evidence%2C+Nanotechnology%2C+Explosives%2C+Crime+Scene+Photography%2C+Chemical+Analysis%2C+Quantification%2C+Fingerprint+Development%2C+Digital+and+Crypto+Forensics%2C+Mass+Disaster+Victim+Management%2C+Firearms%2C+Accreditation%2C+Certification%2C+and+Laboratory+Operations.%0A%0ASchedule%3A%0ATuesday%2C+June+3%3A+In-person%2C+MARC+290%2C+and+live-streamed+online%0AWednesday+%26+Thursday%2C+June+4+%26+5%3A+Livestream+only%0A%0AWhether+you+attend+in-person+or+virtually+-+registration+is+FREE%21+%0A%0ARegister+today+at+go.fiu.edu%2FFSSregistration.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2F2025-global-forensic-science-symposium%0A">Email this event</a></p> ]]>

<title>Jun 11, 2025: 5 Signs the Job is a Scam</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>In today's competitive landscape, exciting opportunities can seem like a lifeline. Unfortunately, so can sophisticated job scams designed to steal your personal information, your money, and your time.</p> <p> </p> <p>This workshop will equip you with the knowledge and skills to navigate the job search safely and confidently. We'll pull back the curtain on the tactic's scammers use, revealing the red flags that often go unnoticed. <item>
<title>Jun 19, 2025: FIU Celebrates Juneteenth</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Juneteenth celebrates African American freedom and achievement, while encouraging continuous self-development. As recommended in our Equity Action Initiative, FIU seeks to align with the spirit of this holiday, to make Juneteenth an official day of observance at Florida International University. Additionally, we stand in support of the Student Government Association of Florida.</p> <p>The theme for FIU first inaugural Juneteenth celebration is â€œEducate, Celebrate, and Healâ€. Educating, celebrating, and embracing the truths of Juneteenth can serve to expand the collective knowledge of our entire FIU community and accelerate an appreciation for the Black history excluded from pedagogy, that may have framed a different America. Celebrating Juneteenth complements the work of the Founding Fathers, being the architects of the Declaration of Independence, and brings to the conversation, the 400 years Blacks have tried to achieve equality in enjoying â€˜life, liberty and the pursuit of happinessâ€™. During this week of observance, we will provide programming and activities to commemorate Juneteenth beginning June 14 and culminating with a Juneteenth Freedom Day Celebration on Saturday, June 19 from 10am to 4pm. To learn more about this celebration, visit <a href="https://ace.fiu.edu/juneteenth/">https://ace.fiu.edu/juneteenth/</a></p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/fiu_celebrates_juneteenth">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+FIU+Celebrates+Juneteenth&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Jun+19%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0AJuneteenth+celebrates+African+American+freedom+and+achievement%2C+while+encouraging+continuous+self-development.+As+recommended+in+our+Equity+Action+Initiative%2C+FIU+seeks+to+align+with+the+spirit+of+this+holiday%2C+to+make+Juneteenth+an+official+day+of+observance+at+Florida+International+University.+Additionally%2C+we+stand+in+support+of+the+Student+Government+Association+of+Florida.%0A%0AThe+theme+for+FIU+first+inaugural+Juneteenth+celebration+is+%E2%80%9CEducate%2C+Celebrate%2C+and+Heal%E2%80%9D.+Educating%2C+celebrating%2C+and+embracing+the+truths+of+Juneteenth+can+serve+to+expand+the+collective+knowledge+of+our+entire+FIU+community+and+accelerate+an+appreciation+for+the+Black+history+excluded+from+pedagogy%2C+that+may+have+framed+a+different+America.+Celebrating+Juneteenth+complements+the+work+of+the+Founding+Fathers%2C+being+the+architects+of+the+Declaration+of+Independence%2C+and+brings+to+the+conversation%2C+the+400+years+Blacks+have+tried+to+achieve+equality+in+enjoying+%E2%80%98life%2C+liberty+and+the+pursuit+of+happiness%E2%80%99.+During+this+week+of+observance%2C+we+will+provide+programming+and+activities+to+commemorate+Juneteenth+beginning+June+14+and+culminating+with+a+Juneteenth+Freedom+Day+Celebration+on+Saturday%2C+June+19+from+10am+to+4pm.+To+learn+more+about+this+celebration%2C+visit+https%3A%2F%2Face.fiu.edu%2Fjuneteenth%2F%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2Ffiu_celebrates_juneteenth%0A">Email this event</a></p> ]]>

<description>

<item>
<title>Jun 24, 2025: 20th Annual Government Statewide Conference at GC - Graham University Center</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Hello Panther!</p> <p>Interested in learning more about public service career opportunities? Did you know the local, state, and federal government agencies and departments offer internships, full-time and part-time career opportunities and fellowships? Join us at the 20th Annual Government Statewide Conference to meet hiring managers, recruiters, and representatives! Learn about preparing for and applying to federal career opportunities!</p> <p>Date: Tuesday June 24th, 2025</p> <p>Time: 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. EDT</p> <p>Location: Florida International University, Modesto A. Maidique Campus, Graham Center, GC Ballroom</p> <p>Address: 11200 SW 8th St, Miami, FL 33199</p> <p> </p> <p>This 20th Annual Government Statewide Conference is designed to bring representatives from various government entities together to discuss aspects of government employment, best practices, employment opportunities, and several other relevant topics geared for students, alumni, professionals, and veterans.</p> <p>After our speaker and panelist sessions on government employment, we host a resource fair for participating agencies and students will get the opportunity to visit and network with each other.</p> <p>The 20th Annual Government Conference is open to FIU students and alumni as well as Miami-Dade College and State University System of Florida students. All must register to attend on Handshake. All student attendees must present a college or university ID to be admitted.</p> <p>If you have any questions, please contact Career and Talent Development at <a href="mailto:career@fiu.edu">career@fiu.edu</a> or call (305) 348-2423</p> <p>Government Statewide Conference is open to all current FIU students and alumni</p> <p>Should you need an ADA accommodation to participate in this event, or to request materials in an accessible format, please contact FIUâ€™s Office of Civil Rights Compliance and Accessibility (CRCA) at 305-348-2785 or <a href="mailto:ocrca@fiu.edu">ocrca@fiu.edu</a>. All requests for ADA accommodations or accessible materials for this event must be submitted to CRCA at least two weeks prior to the event or at the earliest possible opportunity.</p> <p>RSVP Via (72) Handshake</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/20th-annual-government-statewide-conference">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+20th+Annual+Government+Statewide+Conference&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Jun+24%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0AHello+Panther%21%0A%0AInterested+in+learning+more+about+public+service+career+opportunities%3F+Did+you+know+the+local%2C+state%2C+and+federal+government+agencies+and+departments+offer+internships%2C+full-time+and+part-time+career+opportunities+and+fellowships%3F+Join+us+at+the+20th+Annual+Government+Statewide+Conference+to+meet+hiring+managers%2C+recruiters%2C+and+representatives%21+Learn+about+preparing+for+and+applying+to+federal+career+opportunities%21%0A%0ADate%3A+Tuesday+June+24th%2C+2025%0A%0ATime%3A+9%3A00+a.m.+to+5%3A00+p.m.+EDT%0A%0ALocation%3A+Florida+International+University%2C+Modesto+A.+Maidique+Campus%2C+Graham+Center%2C+GC+Ballroom%0A%0AAddress%3A+11200+SW+8th+St%2C+Miami%2C+FL+33199%0A%0A+%0A%0AThis+20th+Annual+Government+Statewide+Conference+is+designed+to+bring+representatives+from+various+government+entities+together+to+discuss+aspects+of+government+employment%2C+best+practices%2C+employment+opportunities%2C+and+several+other+relevant+topics+geared+for+students%2C+alumni%2C+professionals%2C+and+veterans.%0A%0AAfter+our+speaker+and+panelist+sessions+on+government+employment%2C+we+host+a+resource+fair+for+participating+agencies+and+students+will+get+the+opportunity+to+visit+and+network+with+each+other.%0A%0AThe+20th+Annual+Government+Conference+is+open+to+FIU+students+and+alumni+as+well+as+Miami-Dade+College+and+State+University+System+of+Florida+students.+All+must+register+to+attend+on+Handshake.+All+student+attendees+must+present+a+college+or+university+ID+to+be+admitted.%0A%0AIf+you+have+any+questions%2C+please+contact+Career+and+Talent+Development+at+career%40fiu.edu+or+call+%28305%29+348-2423%0A%0AGovernment+Statewide+Conference+is+open+to+all+current+FIU+students+and+alumni%0A%0AShould+you+need+an+ADA+accommodation+to+participate+in+this+even To celebrate Haitian Heritage Month, the Creole Archive Project: PolonÃ© Nwa - Constitution 1805 by Dr. Jacek KolasiÅ„ski invites viewers to uncover a powerful and often forgotten chapter of Haitian and Polish history. <title>Jul 10, 2025: RCR Workshop: Research Data Management at MARC - Management & Advanced Research</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Presented by: Sonia Santana Arroyo, Research &amp; Data Repository Manager</p> <p>The workshop covers the fundamentals of Research Data Management (RDM), highlighting its importance throughout the research lifecycle while specifically introducing FIU Libraries' data services, including the Research Data Portal built on Dataverse technology. The presentation explains how proper data management enhances research integrity, efficiency, and compliance with funding requirements, while providing practical guidance on data preparation, formatting, and repository selection.</p> <p>Please RSVP by clicking the "Register" button at the top so we can ensure we have enough availability! <item>
<title>Jul 11, 2025: Sinema Chat-28th Annual Haitian Summer Institute Lecture Series at SIPA II</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Sinema Chat is a curated film screening and interactive conversation exploring Haitian identity, memory, diaspora, and belonging. The program features five award-winning short filmsâ€”Tifi, La Vie, Konpa, Boat People, and Prestigeâ€”that reflect on personal and national histories shaping Haitian communities across generations. Following the screening, a lecture will delve into the lived and cultural experiences that inspired each film. The event concludes with Sinema Chat, a dynamic, audience-driven dialogue where viewers engage directly with the filmmaker in an open, conversational format. This unique approach invites deeper reflection on migration, resilience, and the power of storytelling in the Haitian experience.</p> <p>GUEST SPEAKER: Alâ€™ikens Placher is a filmmaker from Haiti. His films have won various awards and screened at a variety of festivals, including winning an HBO BEST SHORT FILM award, having both a world premiere in competition at TRIBECA FILM FESTIVAL, and an OSCAR-QUALIFIED short film.</p> <p>In Haitian Creole. Part of LACCâ€™s Foreign Languages Across the Curriculum (FLAC) Lecture Series and LACCâ€™s Haitian Studies Program of Excellence. Made possible with support from LACCâ€™s US Department of Education Title VI Grant.</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/sinema-chat-28th-annual-haitian-summer-institute-lecture-series">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+Sinema+Chat-28th+Annual+Haitian+Summer+Institute+Lecture+Series&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Jul+11%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0ASinema+Chat+is+a+curated+film+screening+and+interactive+conversation+exploring+Haitian+identity%2C+memory%2C+diaspora%2C+and+belonging.+The+program+features+five+award-winning+short+films%E2%80%94Tifi%2C+La+Vie%2C+Konpa%2C+Boat+People%2C+and+Prestige%E2%80%94that+reflect+on+personal+and+national+histories+shaping+Haitian+communities+across+generations.+Following+the+screening%2C+a+lecture+will+delve+into+the+lived+and+cultural+experiences+that+inspired+each+film.+The+event+concludes+with+Sinema+Chat%2C+a+dynamic%2C+audience-driven+dialogue+where+viewers+engage+directly+with+the+filmmaker+in+an+open%2C+conversational+format.+This+unique+approach+invites+deeper+reflection+on+migration%2C+resilience%2C+and+the+power+of+storytelling+in+the+Haitian+experience.%0A%0AGUEST+SPEAKER%3A+Al%E2%80%99ikens+Placher+is+a+filmmaker+from+Haiti.+His+films+have+won+various+awards+and+screened+at+a+variety+of+festivals%2C+including+winning+an+HBO+BEST+SHORT+FILM+award%2C+having+both+a+world+premiere+in+competition+at+TRIBECA+FILM+FESTIVAL%2C+and+an+OSCAR-QUALIFIED+short+film.%0A%0AIn+Haitian+Creole.+Part+of+LACC%E2%80%99s+Foreign+Languages+Across+the+Curriculum+%28FLAC%29+Lecture+Series+and+LACC%E2%80%99s+Haitian+Studies+Program+of+Excellence.+Made+possible+with+support+from+LACC%E2%80%99s+US+Department+of+Education+Title+VI+Grant.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2Fsinema-chat-28th-annual-haitian-summer-institute-lecture-series%0A">Email this event</a></p> ]]>

<item>
<title>Aug 13, 2025: Hacker Nation ðŸ’¡ at StartUP FIU</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Founded by Robert Hacker, Director and Co-Founder of StartUP FIU, Hacker Nation ðŸ‘¨â€ðŸ« is a dynamic learning community ðŸ§  created to further intellectual discussion about all things related to: SCIENCE ðŸ”¬ TECHNOLOGY ðŸ’» ENTREPRENEURSHIP ðŸ› ï¸ and SOCIAL IMPACTðŸŒ</p> <p> </p> <p>ðŸ”¥ Register for HACKER NATION HERE ðŸ”¥</p> <p> </p> <p>Hacker Nation meets every Wednesday from 12 pm to 1:30 pm to discuss a variety of future-facing topics, including:</p> <p>TECHAIINNOVATIONENTREPRENEURSHIPGAME THEORYSUSTAINABILITYCURRENT EVENTSDESIGN THINKINGPHILOSOPHY &amp; so much more!ðŸ”¥ JOIN HACKER NATIONðŸ”¥</p> <p> </p> <p>Who should attend? <br />Any student, researcher, faculty member, innovator, entrepreneur or explorer who wants to challenge their thinking is welcome to join:</p> <p>* All college majors</p> <p>* All levels of expertise</p> <p>* All academic backgrounds</p> <p>Weekly articles</p> <p>Every Monday, we post 3-5 articles that may be the target of our discussion in that week's meeting. You can find the articles in our link tree here: <a href="https://linktr.ee/hackernation">https://linktr.ee/hackernation</a></p> <p> </p> <p>For HONORS COLLEGE CREDIT, email Honors College Engagement (<a href="mailto:hcengage@fiu.edu">hcengage@fiu.edu</a>) and include: <br />Full name, email address, Panther ID, date of Hacker Nation attended.</p> <p> </p> <p>ðŸ”Ž Any questions? <title>Aug 14, 2025: Last Day to Route Program for Doctoral Degree and Application for Candidacy to GPD</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Thursday, August 14, 2025 is the last day to route the Program for Doctoral Degree and Application for Candidacy to the Graduate Program Director. For questions, please email <a href="mailto:psygrad@fiu.edu">psygrad@fiu.edu</a> </p> <p>Please email to <a href="mailto:psygrad@fiu.edu">psygrad@fiu.edu</a> and <a href="mailto:dgoldfar@fiu.edu">dgoldfar@fiu.edu</a>: (1) memo from PD stating student successfully completed requirements to advance to candidacy and (2) If applicable, copy of studentâ€™s qualifying paper(s) (e.g., publication; grant submission; qualifying paper such as chapter) â€“ this will vary depending on the program you are in as some programs do not have a paper requirement but an exam requirement.</p> <p>Please have your committee complete CASE rubrics and send to <a href="mailto:psygrad@fiu.edu">psygrad@fiu.edu</a> and <a href="mailto:dgoldfar@fiu.edu">dgoldfar@fiu.edu</a></p> <p>The Program for Doctoral Degree and Application for Candidacy Form and required paperwork can be found at Online Dissertation Milestones - University Graduate School</p> <p>To be eligible and what you will be asked:</p> <p>Complete all coursework and required number of credits.Pass all comprehensive and qualifying examination(s), as established by each academic department. These may include language requirements or other departmental requirements (if any).Maintained a 3.0 or higher cumulative GPACleared any incomplete grade(s)Any transfer of credits must be reflected in the FIU transcript prior to submission of this dissertation milestone.In general, doctoral students advanced to candidacy with a minimum of 60 graduate credits.Approved candidacy is required to commence dissertation credits enrollment.</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/copy-of-last-day-to-route-program-for-doctoral-degree-and-application-for-candidacy-to-gpd-3460">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+Last+Day+to+Route+Program+for+Doctoral+Degree+and+Application+for+Candidacy+to+GPD&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Aug+14%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0AThursday%2C+August+14%2C+2025+is+the+last+day+to+route+the+Program+for+Doctoral+Degree+and+Application+for+Candidacy+to+the+Graduate+Program+Director.+For+questions%2C+please+email+psygrad%40fiu.edu+%0A%0APlease+email+to+psygrad%40fiu.edu+and+dgoldfar%40fiu.edu%3A+%281%29+memo+from+PD+stating+student+successfully+completed+requirements+to+advance+to+candidacy+and+%282%29+If+applicable%2C+copy+of+student%E2%80%99s+qualifying+paper%28s%29+%28e.g.%2C+publication%3B+grant+submission%3B+qualifying+paper+such+as+chapter%29+%E2%80%93+this+will+vary+depending+on+the+program+you+are+in+as+some+programs+do+not+have+a+paper+requirement+but+an+exam+requirement.%0A%0APlease+have+your+committee+complete+CASE+rubrics+and+send+to+psygrad%40fiu.edu+and+dgoldfar%40fiu.edu%0A%0AThe+Program+for+Doctoral+Degree+and+Application+for+Candidacy+Form+and+required+paperwork+can+be+found+at+Online+Dissertation+Milestones+-+University+Graduate+School%0A%0ATo+be+eligible+and+what+you+will+be+asked%3A%0A%0AComplete+all+coursework+and+required+number+of+credits.Pass+all+comprehensive+and+qualifying+examination%28s%29%2C+as+established+by+each+academic+department.+These+may+include+language+requirements+or+other+departmental+requirements+%28if+any%29.Maintained+a+3.0+or+higher+cumulative+GPACleared+any+incomplete+grade%28s%29Any+transfer+of+credits+must+be+reflected+in+the+FIU+transcript+prior+to+submission+of+this+dissertation+milestone.In+general%2C+doctoral+students+advanced+to+candidacy+with+a+minimum+of+60+graduate+credits.Approved+candidacy+is+required+to+commence+dissertation+credits+enrollment.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2Fcopy-of-last-day-to-route-program-for-doctoral-degree-and-application-for-candidacy-to-gpd-3460%0A">Email <title>Sep 4, 2025: Certified Treasury Professional (CTPÂ®) Certificate Program</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>The unprecedented disruptions now rolling through global markets are dealing a blow to many capital models and cash strategies. <item>
<title>Dec 17, 2025: Hacker Nation ðŸ’¡ at StartUP FIU</title>

<title>Apr 7, 2026: Veterans and Military Affairs Inaugural Fly-In at FIU in DC</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>FIUâ€™s DC Fly-Ins are three-day experiential seminars focused on exploring how policies are made, and what career opportunities exist in the capital for students passionate about a variety of issues. The itineraries consist of engaging conversations and experiences with experts across government, academia and industry.
